instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3462 low ppbus no green light
threads.message:
this came in, no visible liquid damage, but whole board is dusty
ppdcin is 16.5v normal
pp3v42 present, but no green /orange light.
adapter sense up to pin 2 of j6900 is normal 3.4v,
ppbus is 1v
resistance between pin 17/18 :4 ohm
27/28 is 20 ohm
smc_reset_l is 2.8v at first,after I reball smc, now at 3.2v
should I worry about ppbus later until I get magsafe light ?

threads.title: 820-3462 low ppbus no green light
threads.message:
PPBUS_G3H must appear, even if no Magsafe light present.
Post ISL6259 voltages; pins 1, 2, 3, 6, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 19, 20, 27.

threads.title: 820-3462 low ppbus no green light
threads.message: pin 1 is 0v, i look another post is at least 16.5v, and I have changed q7080 before fyi

threads.title: 820-3462 low ppbus no green light
threads.message:
"pin 1 is 0v, i look another post is at least 16.5v"
No idea what you've seen, but not true at all; 0V is perfect at pin1.

Check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28.
Post diode mode to ground at L7030.
Check/replace R/C7025.

threads.title: 820-3462 low ppbus no green light
threads.message:
resistance 17/18 : 3 ohm 27/28 20 ohm
diode mode L7030 : 0.466v
r7025 is good at 0.1 ohm
c7025 is not shorted.

threads.title: 820-3462 low ppbus no green light
threads.message:
"c7025 is not shorted"
Does this mean to have good capacity???

Check R/C networks from pins 5, 7, 8.

threads.title: 820-3462 low ppbus no green light
threads.message:
yeah good capacity, diode mode to ground on pin 1 of c7025 is 0.533v,  pin 2 0.121v
r7042 : 0 ohm
r7015 : 99k ohm
r7016 : 3 kohm, all good according to schematic

threads.title: 820-3462 low ppbus no green light
threads.message:
i usually look for another post as reference, but low ppbus's post is too limited..
i can assure u7000 soldering is good, maybe the chip itself is bad ?

threads.title: 820-3462 low ppbus no green light
threads.message: i have changed u7000 multiple times, but all same, ppbus is still at 1-1.1v.. im rather sure the problem isnt u7000 then

threads.title: 820-3462 low ppbus no green light
threads.message: Remove F7040 and check voltage at L7030.

threads.title: 820-3462 low ppbus no green light
threads.message:
"27 1v"
I don't know why I didn't see it before...

Change Q7080.

threads.title: 820-3462 low ppbus no green light
threads.message:
changed q7080, ppbus back 12.26
changed smc, ppbus 12.6v
thanks a lot, solved..
